title: KKR Swings to a Profit
sub_head: Private-equity firm posts total quarterly revenue of $4.56 billion, compared with negative revenue a year earlier
body:
Private-equity firm KKR & Co. reported a profit in the latest quarter as it reported positive investment income and revenue.
The firm’s profit before accounting for preferred stock dividends was $1.67 billion compared with a loss of $1.28 billion a year earlier. Earnings attributable to the company per share of its common stock were $2.68 a share. A year earlier, the company had a loss of $2.31 a share.
The company reported after-tax distributable earnings per adjusted share —or cash that can be returned to shareholders—of 75 cents a share.
KKR reported $2.89 billion in total investment income for asset management. A year earlier, that was negative $3.68 billion.
Total revenue at KKR was $4.56 billion, compared with negative revenue a year earlier of $1 billion. The company reported more than $3 billion in revenue from assessment management and over $1 billion in insurance revenue. A year earlier, the firm’s revenue from asset management was negative $1 billion.
